programme.title: Mister Winner
programme.desc: Leslie is not looking forward to his mum's birthday lunch. Her new boyfriend Steve is only a year older than Leslie, and Leslie understandably finds their public displays of affection uncomfortable.

programme.title: George Clarke's Old House, New Home
programme.desc: In Hampshire, George visits a Grade II listed worker's cottage that's restricted for planning permission. For inspiration George visits a stunning home complete with gym, cinema and roof garden, that started life as a simple Victorian stable.

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc: Host Anita Manning is at the market town of Dorking in Surrey. Experts Danny Sebastian and David Harper help the teams find some bargains in the town's antique shops that they hope will make a profit at auction. The reds take some risks, while the blues cannot contain their excitement.

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc: Eric Knowles presents from the charming market town of Leominster in Herefordshire. Keeping the teams in check are experts Caroline Hawley and Thomas Plant. Plus, Eric Knowles finds out more about a local piece of pharmacy history.

programme.title: DIY SOS
programme.desc: Sue's family have lived in Fegg Hayes, Stoke, for six generations. To help tackle issues of food poverty, isolation and mental health in the area, she set up a charity, Sylvester's. They have taken over a patch of wasteland in the heart of the community with the aim of creating a community centre and garden with room to grow vegetables and space where old and young can share knowledge and experiences.

programme.title: Ghosts
programme.desc: Fortune smiles on a cash-strapped Mike and Alison when a TV company comes calling looking for an old house in which to film their period drama. To get the money in the bank, Alison must ensure the shoot goes without a hitch.

programme.title: Josh
programme.desc: The old lady upstairs blackmails Josh into accepting and carrying all her heavy deliveries, mimic Owen starts to fall for a beautiful American woman who thinks he is from Cork rather than Carmarthenshire, and Kate helps Geoff nurse a sick bird.

programme.title: Mister Winner
programme.desc: Leslie is not looking forward to his mum's birthday lunch. Her new boyfriend Steve is only a year older than Leslie, and Leslie understandably finds their public displays of affection uncomfortable.

programme.title: Antiques Roadshow
programme.desc: Fiona Bruce discovers what was really inside a 200 year old bottle of wine that Andy McConnell foolishly tasted in 2016 and traces the history of a chocolate treat in the shape of the nurse that dates back to the First World War.

programme.title: Amazing Hotels: Life Beyond the Lobby
programme.desc: Giles and Monica travel to South Africa where they experience a land of contrasts through working in two very different hotels. The Silo is an industrial-chic, luxury art-themed hotel in the heart of Cape Town. It sits in the former elevator shaft of a 90-year-old 187-foot grain silo (once dubbed the tallest building in sub-Saharan Africa).

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc: Two competitive teams travel to an antique fair at Wetherby Racecourse. Eric Knowles is joined by Nick Hall and Jonathan Pratt who help the reds and blues race around the fair, spending up to £300 on three items which hopefully will make a profit at the auction in Darlington.

programme.title: Impossible
programme.desc: Thirty players compete across the series, scoring points by answering questions correctly. However, they must avoid the impossible answers, otherwise they will be eliminated from the show until the next day.

programme.title: The Great British Sewing Bee
programme.desc: Savile Row's Patrick Grant and sewing teacher May Martin set the contestants a pattern for a child's dress which tests their ability to follow couture techniques on a miniature scale. In the alteration challenge, they are asked to tailor a dress with precision. They must also create a made-to-measure jacket which must fit the model perfectly.

programme.title: Mister Winner
programme.desc: Leslie finds a piano while on a house clearance job with his father-in-law Chris. Chris thinks they should take it straight to the dump but Leslie thinks he can sell it to an antique dealer for a small fortune.

programme.desc: When one of Chris's regular labourers calls in sick, he reluctantly agrees to let Leslie take on a decorating job. It is two walls and a hallway, how hard can that be? The client, an elderly chap called Graham, turns out to be very short sighted.

programme.sub-title: Children in Need Special 2020: Caswell Bay
programme.desc: The DIY SOS team descend on Caswell Bay, Swansea, where, on behalf of Surfability UK, which receives funding from Children in Need, they transform a dilapidated, disused bus shelter into the world's first purpose-built, fully adaptive surf centre. programme.title: Bloomberg Daybreak: Asia
programme.desc: With Asia being about half a day ahead of America, when people are getting ready to settle in for the night in the US the day is just starting in places like China and Japan that are important to the global economy. Featuring anchors in both New York and Hong Kong, `Bloomberg Daybreak Asia' features business and financial guests, in addition to providing insights into news and movements in global markets. This instalment of `Daybreak' joins other geographically focused versions of the show that highlight financial news in other regions.

programme.title: Bloomberg Markets: China Open
programme.desc: The definitive guide to the markets in Hong Kong and on the mainland. Rishaad Salamat, David Ingles, Tom Mackenzie and Yvonne Man bring the latest news and analysis to start the trading day.

programme.title: Bloomberg Markets: Asia
programme.desc: In an effort to provide extensive coverage of worldwide financial markets, Bloomberg features several regional shows under the `Bloomberg Markets' banner, with each focusing on that geographic area's markets. This Asian-focused version is hosted by Shery Ahn, David Ingles, Haidi Lun, Rishaad Salamat and Angie Lau. They report the latest business news and speak with the likes of political and business leaders to help investors make decisions that build their portfolios.

programme.title: Bloomberg Daybreak: Middle East
programme.desc: Connecting the Asian and European markets by addressing the global issues with a context specific to the Middle East.

programme.title: Bloomberg Daybreak: Europe
programme.desc: `Bloomberg Daybreak: Europe' joins the network's lineup to deliver viewers information about business and financial news from the region. Manus Cranny and Anna Edwards host the show from London, joined by business professionals and journalists who offer their thoughts on the day's industry happenings. This instalment of `Daybreak' joins other geographically focused versions of the show that highlight financial news in other regions.

programme.title: Bloomberg Markets: Europe
programme.desc: Bloomberg Markets: Europe is a fast-paced hour of news and analysis, building towards the drama and excitement of the start of trading across the continent.

programme.title: Bloomberg Markets: European Open
programme.desc: Thanks to the time difference between the locations, the financial markets in Europe open when most Americans are sleeping. Bloomberg covers the start of the European trading day with this show - which airs in the early morning hours in the Eastern time zone - as part of the network's programming block dedicated to covering financial activity overseas. The show, broadcast from London, features discussions of the stories that are expected to impact the European markets that day and, subsequently, other markets around the world.

programme.title: Bloomberg Markets: Americas
programme.desc: In an effort to provide extensive coverage of worldwide financial markets, Bloomberg features several regional shows under the `Bloomberg Markets' banner, with each focusing on that geographic area's markets. programme.title: Bloomberg Markets: European Close
programme.desc: Thanks to the time difference between the locations, the financial markets in Europe close when the American markets are still in full swing. Bloomberg covers the end of the European trading day with this half-hour show - which airs in the morning US time, afternoon in Europe - during the network's `Bloomberg Markets' programming block. The show is hosted by two anchors on separate continents - Betty Liu in Bloomberg's New York studio and Mark Barton in London - who discuss the stories that impacted the European markets that day. The show also features sound bites from some of the day's biggest news.

programme.desc: Host, columnist, and best-selling author Fareed Zakaria offers insightful analysis and interviews world leaders, artists, scientists, business leaders, global affairs analysts, and other cultural observers for the `Global Public Square'. Zakaria is also a syndicated columnist for The Washington Post, a contributing editor for The Atlantic magazine, and hosts in-depth, prime-time specials for CNN Worldwide. `Fareed Zakaria GPS' was launched in 2008 and each week's program airs worldwide on CNN, from New York or other locations around the world. The program is characterized by smart debate and discussion on world events and public affairs, designed to help viewers understand the world around them and the newest thinking on the globe's biggest challenges.

programme.title: The Situation Room With Wolf Blitzer
programme.desc: Anchor Wolf Blitzer invites CNN correspondents, analysts and guests for timely coverage of the day's news events. programme.title: Erin Burnett OutFront
programme.desc: It's Erin Burnett's turn to step out front and try to maintain a viable viewer presence for CNN in the weekday news arena. But the former CNBC anchor won't worry about ratings for her hourlong general news program, comparing that burden to "death." Instead, she'll concern herself with translating world events into relevant information for viewers, paying close attention to such topics as the Middle East and women's issues. "I want people to say that our show is smart. I want our show to be authentic", Burnett says in a promo. "I want our show to have courage". Left unsaid, of course, is that she wants her show to have a big audience, too.
